column4: ive always wondered, all these open source projects that have really strict coding conventions, is there someone sitting and validating all committed code? or do they have a program to do it?
Each open source project has its own code of conduct when it comes to code clean-ness and correctness - some are very loose, some are rigid and diligently vet each line.
It's important to understand that open source projects, lacking centralization or corporate control, are community-driven and that blanket statements cannot be made.
